intro: Enthomanthus fibrosus, commonly known as the fibrous entho, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a rough texture. The fibrous nature of its stems makes it useful in traditional crafts and as a source of fiber.
